tourName: Safari and Zanzibar beach holiday, Tanzania
generalInfo: The Maasai are a proud community in northern Tanzania, recognized for their bright red clothing, beautiful beadwork, and unique traditions. Cattle are at the heart of their way of life, symbolizing wealth, food, and culture. They are also famous for their energetic jumping dance and strong sense of identity. Your stay at Tembo Lodge is an invitation to explore, connect, and make a difference. From breathtaking savannah vistas and mountain hikes to cultural encounters with Maasai communities, this is the real Tanzania —authentic, personal, and unforgettable. you will get a chance to visit Mkomazi is in northern Tanzania, part of a large ecosystem, with rare colobus monkeys, a rich savannah, and a large gerenuk population, wild dog and rhino sanctuary .Later you will unwind at stone town with some activities and also enjoy the beach.

dayInfo.description: Upon your arrival day at Kilimanjaro International Airport (JRO) and after M&G with our representative (driver guide). Your journey begins the moment you arrive at Tembo Lodge. Warmly greeted by the Maasai staff, you settle into your charming bungalow and take in sweeping views of the savannah and distant mountains. Connect with the Maasai culture in a playful spear-throwing session guided by skilled warriors, then join the Maasai sundowner dance as the sun sets painting the plains with warm magical colors of an African sunset. Sip a refreshing drink, enjoy a light snack, and end the evening around a crackling bonfire, sharing stories beneath a sky full of stars.

Spend the day connecting with the heart of the Maasai community. Visit the local school supported by the lodge, meet the children, and see how education is making a real impact on the next generation and the wider community. In the evening, step into a traditional Maasai boma to experience daily life and gain insight into a culture that has thrived in harmony with the land for centuries.

Early in the morning, you set out with packed breakfast and lunch for a full day adventure to the Enduimet Wildlife Management Area, just an hour drive from Tinga Tinga. Lying at the foot of Mount Kilimanjaro, it is known for its large elephant population and unspoiled landscapes. With few visitors, Enduimet offers a rare, authentic safari where wildlife and the Maasai live side by side. Expect sweeping views, diverse wildlife, and a true sense of wilderness before returning to the lodge in the afternoon. In the evening join the Maasai for a traditional Maasai BBQ around the fireplace.

An early wake-up call with coffee and then wander through the savanna on a guided bushwalk, learning about local plants and Maasai traditions. With wildlife as your next door neighbours, you might come across giraffes and zebras along the way. After breakfast, step into the highlight of the Maasai week with a visit to the vibrant local market. Here the villagers gather not only to trade but also to connect- sharing stories, laughter, and news of daily life. Fresh vegetables, local shoes, colorful fabrics and even goats and cattle making the market a lively window into the Maasai culture. You´ll also meet the women´s groups supported by the lodge’s NGO Maasailand Development: a sewing and a beadwork group. Sit with them, learn traditional craft, and perhaps create a piece of beadwork yourself. Their beautiful designs bring life and color to Tembo Lode, each piece carrying a story of tradition and empowerment.

Today after the breakfast you can have early morning game drive and later head off to Mkomazi national Park, via Kilimanjaro North scenic route, upon your arrival you'll proceed with the game drive. Drive to your camp before dark for the overnight stay

Today early in the Moring start your game in this less visited park enjoy the sundown and the sunrise from the magnificent mountain views found in this park. Visit the rhinoceros and the wild dog’s projects situated in the park. Return to your camp in the afternoon for the overnight stay. The tented lodge is located inside the park.

After breakfast drive to Kilimanjaro airport for your flight to Zanzibar upon arrival at Zanzibar international airport you will meet with our representative and transfer to the hotel in stone town.The Emerson team offers a full-evening dining experience with a Swahili and Middle Eastern theme, starting at 6:00 PM with cocktails, mocktails, and an aperitif. The waiters will introduce you to the menu, the setting, and the traditions surrounding Zanzibar celebrations. At 7:00 PM, the first course of the meal is served, and musicians from the Dhow Countries Music Academy begin playing traditional Taarab music. Dinner continues with a variety of dishes, and the evening concludes unusually around 9:00 PM to 9:30 PM with a cup of "tangawizi"—Zanzibar ginger tea—after dessert is served.

Stone Town tour Stone Town is the old city and cultural heart of Zanzibar and little has changed in the last 200 years. It is a place of winding alleys, bustling bazaars, mosques and grand Arab houses. Stone Town has brought together many different elements of the cultures of Africa, the Arab region, India, and Europe over more than a thousand years. You can spend endless hours just wandering through the fascinating labyrinth of narrow streets and alleyways, absorbing the years of history. You will enjoy a guided tour of this fascinating town, recently and deservedly declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Late afternoon Mahanjumati tour (food tour with Forodhani) In Kiswahili, “mahanjumati” means a feast of different delicacies. Zanzibar’s cuisine reflects the island’s cosmopolitan spirit. Indian, Arab, Persian, African and Western influences create a wide variety of tasty dishes and snacks. Most of these won’t be served in tourist restaurants; they are prepared in Swahili homes and small local eateries. On this leisurely walk through Stone Town’s alleyways, we will take you to the best (and hygienically safe!) places to sample these local delicacies. Make it a breakfast or dinner experience, depending on your timing!

Spice tour Today you will visit one of the island's many spice plantations. The export of exotic spice has unfortunately been drastically reduced in the last century, yet Zanzibar still boasts the excellent quality and wide variety of spice and tropical fruit. During a tour at such a Spice Farm you will see and taste many different herbs, and the guide will explain to you all about its cultivation and use. Cloves, cinnamon, vanilla, cumin, cardamom, nutmeg, ginger, chili, black pepper, but also guava, mango, pineapple, papaya.... All these delicious flavours and textures will certainly be found in the meals at your hotel. Sunset cruise Zanzibar is known for its beautiful sunsets. A unique and enjoyable way to enjoy them is with a sunset cruise on a dhow. A dhow is a traditional Arabic wooden sailing boat that is still widely used here. The cruise lasts approximately two hours. If the wind cooperates, the crew will hoist the sails so you can peacefully enjoy the beautiful surroundings as the sun slowly sinks below the horizon. Drinks and snacks are served on board.

Snorkelling with Sandbank / Deserted Beach BBQ (from Kizimkazi) Leave from Kizimkazi, lean back and enjoy the sound of the waves for 1.5 hours sailing until you reach the Pungume corals - one of Zanzibar's top 3 snorkelling spots. After snorkelling you will continue to a deserted beach far from mass tourism or the Pungume sandbank if the tides allow. While enjoying the beach, the sea and the view, the crew will prepare a delicious BBQ that is guaranteed to impress you with the local cuisine. Sea treasures together with local specialities and exotic fruits are on the menu. After lunch it’s time for a little rest, reading, taking a swim or just enjoying the breathtaking views. With a cold beverage in hand and a camera to immortalize paradise, there is not much more you need...
Today it's your last day in Zanzibar depend on your international flight schedule you'll be transfer to Zanzibar International airport for your flight back home.
